head.title: Varying the Ethnic Flavors and Personalities of Calamari

hedline.hl1: Varying the Ethnic Flavors and Personalities of Calamari

block.p: CALAMARI -- as the Italians call squid - when briefly cooked and then tossed with sharp seasoning, can provide a quick yet apetite-whetting summer dish. The calamari can take on different ethnic personalities, depending on the ingredients added.

CALAMARI -- as the Italians call squid - when briefly cooked and then tossed with sharp seasoning, can provide a quick yet apetite-whetting summer dish. The calamari can take on different ethnic personalities, depending on the ingredients added.

The following recipes, all salads of one sort or another, can be served as a first course, a buffet dish or a main dish at lunch. Each dresses the calamari differently, with Italian, Asian and Mexican flavors. These dishes can be prepared in advance but should be allowed to come nearly to room temperature before serving.
Calamari Panzanella
Total time: 30 minutes

Juice of 2 lemons Salt to taste 2 pounds cleaned squid, sliced in rings 2 cups crustless country bread torn in small pieces 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 4 large cloves garlic, minced 6 ripe plum tomatoes, chopped 1 medium red onion, sliced thin 2 tablespoons finely minced flat leaf parsley 1 tablespoon finely shredded fresh basil Hot red pepper flakes to taste.
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Bring two quarts of water to a boil.
2. When water boils add juice half a lemon and season with a teaspoon salt. Add squid, stir and when water returns to a boil, drain the squid and allow to cool to room temperature.
3. Spread bread on a baking sheet, put in oven and bake until bread has dried out and turned lightly golden. Set aside.
4. Heat three tablespoons of oil in a heavy skillet, stir in garlic, remove from heat immediately and add toasted bread. Toss.

5. Put squid in serving bowl and toss with remaining lemon juice. Fold in tomatoes, onion, parsley and basil. Just before serving, fold in oiled toasted bread and remaining oil. Season to taste with salt, add hot red pepper flakes to taste and serve.
Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
Asian Calamari Salad With Pineapple
Total time: 30 minutes plus 2 hours marinating

2 pounds cleaned squid Juice of 1/2 lemon Salt 2 tablespoons light soy sauce 1 tablespoons rice vinegar 1 teaspoon Japanese wasabi paste Juice of 1 lime 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger 2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil 1/2 cup finely chopped scallions 1 cup chopped fresh pineapple Freshly ground black pepper to taste 1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro leaves.

1. Slice squid into thin rings Coarsely chop tentacles. Bring two quarts of water to a boil and add lemon juice and salt to taste. Add squid. When the water returns to a boil, drain squid thoroughly and transfer to a mixing bowl.
2. Add soy sauce and rice vinegar to warm squid. Dissolve wasabi paste in lime juice and add along with ginger and sesame oil. Refrigerate and allow to marinate at least two hours.
3. Before serving, fold in scallions and pineapple. Season to taste with pepper and, if needed, some salt. Scatter chopped cilantro on top.
Yield: 8 servings.
Mexican Calamari With Corn
Total time: 45 minuts

1 1/2 pounds cleaned squid 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil 1 teaspoon chili powder Juice of 3 limes 1 sweet red pepper, seeded, cored and cut in quarters vertically Kernels from 3 ears fresh corn 1/2 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced, or to taste 4 ripe plum tomatoes, chopped Salt and cayenne pepper to taste 1 tablespoon minced fresh cilantro 1/2 cup crushed unsalted tortilla chips.
1. preheat broiler or grill. Brush squid with a little oil, then toss with chili powder and the juice of a lime. Grill or broil squid until seared. Remove from heat.
2. Grill or broil pepper, skin side up, until blackened. Put pepper in paper or plastic bag, close bag and set aside 10 minutes.
3. Slice squid into thin rings, keeping tentacles whole. Put in a bowl. Rub blackened skin off peppers and dice them. Add to squid.

4. Bring small saucepan of water to a boil, add corn, cook two minutes and drain well. Add corn to squid along with jalapeno, tomatoes and remaining oil and lime juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving dish or to six individual plates and top with cilanto and tortilla chips.
Yield: 6 servings.
